markw wrote:

> Hello,
>
> Just running the crawler without the wui (-nowui) and with FOREGROUND 
> set - it does my crawl fine but the process is not terminating. Is 
> that normal? and is there anyway to get it do so?

Thats the way it currently works (It should probably shut itself down if 
nowui and it was passed a job on the cmdline).

There is a shutdown.sh script in the bin directory.  Try calling that 
after you notice job completion.   It works by invoking JMX shutdown 
operation against the local instance.  You could also use JMX to watch 
for crawl job completion if needed. See 
http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#cmdlinecontrol.

Yours,
St.Ack

>
> (again - Java 1.5 and Gentoo)
